intro: Lannea cuneifoliolata, commonly known as the African wild pear, is a deciduous tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with lanceolate leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by woody, spherical fruits. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their potential health benefits. Lannea cuneifoliolata is well adapted to arid environments and can thrive in poor soil conditions.
